options: The man should finish the paper tonight
The man does not need to rush
short_questions.explanation: Wanita itu menyatakan bahwa batas waktu masih bulan depan ('the deadline isn't until next month'), sehingga tidak perlu terburu-buru.

short_questions.questionText: What does the man suggest the woman do?
options: Buy the book at the bookstore
Wait for the book to be returned
short_questions.explanation: Pria itu menyarankan untuk bertanya kepada pustakawan di meja reservasi.

options: She thinks the picnic should be canceled
She believes the weather will improve
short_questions.explanation: Wanita itu berkata 'clear up by noon', yang berarti cuaca akan membaik.
Wanita itu secara eksplisit menyatakan 'This soup is freezing cold'.

short_questions.questionText: What is the main topic of the talk?
short_questions.explanation: Profesor memulai dengan mengatakan 'Today we are going to discuss photosynthesis'.

short_questions.questionText: What has changed about the orientation?
short_questions.explanation: Lokasi orientasi berubah karena telah dipindahkan ke gedung olahraga ('has been moved to the gymnasium').

short_questions.questionText: What does the woman suggest the man do?
options: Wait for the cafeteria to open
short_questions.explanation: Wanita itu menyarankan untuk memeriksa 'Lost and Found section', yang mengisyaratkan dia harus kembali untuk mencarinya.

options: The woman should come back at 2:00
He does not know where the office is
short_questions.explanation: Karena jam kantor dimulai pukul 2:00, implikasinya adalah dia harus menunggu sampai waktu tersebut untuk bertemu dengannya.

options: Talk to the roommate or buy earplugs
short_questions.explanation: Dia secara eksplisit menyarankan 'talking to him' atau 'buying some earplugs'.

short_questions.questionText: Why does the woman decide to take the class?
short_questions.explanation: Dia berkata, 'I don't mind writing if the content is interesting.'

short_questions.questionText: What evidence suggests Mars was once wet?
options: The red color of the planet
Ice caps found by the rover
short_questions.explanation: Profesor menyebutkan 'geological evidence, such as dried-up riverbeds'.

short_questions.questionText: Where should students go if they want to study in a group?
short_questions.explanation: Pemandu menyatakan: 'Group study rooms are available on the second floor'.

options: Happy to be on the subway
short_questions.explanation: Pria tersebut merasa menyesal memilih bus daripada kereta bawah tanah: 'We should have just taken the subway'.

short_questions.questionText: According to the speaker, what was a result of the Gold Rush?
short_questions.explanation: Pembicara menyebutkan 'led to the rapid growth of cities like San Francisco'.

short_questions.questionText: What is an advantage of buying at the student store?
short_questions.explanation: Wanita itu menyebutkan 'the student store offers a discount if you show your ID', yang menjelaskan keuntungan berupa potongan harga bagi pelajar.

short_questions.questionText: What is probably wrong with the man?
short_questions.explanation: Pria itu berkata, 'I think I caught that flu going around'.
Wanita itu menyebutkan 'new sandwich shop across the street' sebagai saran tempat makan siang baru yang berkualitas baik.

short_questions.questionText: What advice does the man give the woman?
options: Practice alone in front of a mirror
Write down everything she wants to say
short_questions.explanation: Pria itu secara eksplisit bertanya, 'Why don't you try practicing in front of a mirror?'

short_questions.questionText: What does the woman imply the man should do?
options: Buy stamps at a grocery store
Ask someone else to mail it
short_questions.explanation: Dia menjelaskan bahwa kantor pos bisa menanganinya tanpa perangko, yang mengisyaratkan dia harus pergi ke sana.

short_questions.questionText: According to the speaker, why do animals hibernate?
options: To hunt for food more easily
short_questions.explanation: Pembicara menyatakan bahwa proses ini 'allows the animal to conserve energy'.

options: The man has a long way to walk
The stadium is behind the library
short_questions.explanation: Wanita itu berkata 'You have quite a walk ahead of you' dan menyebutkan lokasinya di sisi lain kampus, yang mengisyaratkan jaraknya jauh.

short_questions.questionText: What does the man suggest the woman do?
options: Practice speaking in front of a mirror
Look at herself in the mirror
short_questions.explanation: Pria itu secara eksplisit berkata 'run through it a few times in front of a mirror'.

short_questions.questionText: What will the woman probably do tonight?
options: Go to the movies with the man
short_questions.explanation: Dia berkata harus 'cover a shift', yang berarti dia harus bekerja.

short_questions.questionText: What does the man ask for?
short_questions.explanation: Pria itu meminta 'receipt', yang merupakan bukti pembelian yang diperlukan untuk pengembalian barang.

options: She didn't go to the interview
short_questions.explanation: Idiom 'It was a breeze' berarti sesuatu sangat mudah.

options: He wants a cup of tea
He likes the painting very much
He does not like the painting
short_questions.explanation: Idiom 'not my cup of tea' berarti seseorang tidak suka atau tidak tertarik pada sesuatu.

options: She wants the man to repeat himself
She strongly agrees with the man
She thinks the service is fast
short_questions.explanation: Ekspresi 'You can say that again' digunakan untuk menunjukkan persetujuan kuat terhadap apa yang baru saja dikatakan.

options: The book is definitely on the shelf
The book might be lost or in the wrong place
He did not look for the book
short_questions.explanation: Dia berkata sudah mencari tapi tidak menemukannya, yang menunjukkan bukunya mungkin 'misplaced' (diletakkan di tempat yang salah).

short_questions.questionText: What does the woman think is the problem?
options: The car is out of gas
short_questions.explanation: Wanita tersebut menduga baterai mobil habis ('drained the battery') karena lampu dibiarkan menyala.

options: He wants the woman to leave town
short_questions.explanation: Ekspresi 'Get out of town!' merupakan ungkapan idiomatis yang menunjukkan rasa terkejut atau tidak percaya terhadap berita yang menggembirakan.

options: It is a good time to jog
She wants to go with him
short_questions.explanation: Dia menyebutkan mendengar 'thunder' dan menyarankan untuk menunggu, yang mengisyaratkan cuaca buruk (badai) akan datang.

options: He has not done enough work yet
short_questions.explanation: 'Behind schedule' berarti dia belum menyelesaikan pekerjaan sebanyak yang seharusnya pada waktu ini.

short_questions.questionText: What is the woman probably going to do?
short_questions.explanation: Dia berkata perlu 'sit down and drink some water', yang berarti istirahat dan minum air.

short_questions.questionText: What does the man say about the haircut?
short_questions.explanation: Idiom 'cost a fortune' berarti sangat mahal.
Dia berencana untuk 'backpack through Europe', yang berarti bepergian ke luar negeri.

options: He was taller than the professor
He did not understand the lecture
short_questions.explanation: Idiom 'went right over my head' berarti informasinya terlalu sulit untuk dipahami.

short_questions.questionText: Why does the woman choose tea?
options: She doesn't like the taste of coffee
Coffee makes her nervous or shaky
short_questions.explanation: Dia berkata kopi membuatnya 'jittery' (gelisah/gemetar), itulah mengapa dia menghindarinya.
Dia menyarankan menunggu sampai minggu depan untuk 'big sale', yang mengisyaratkan menunggu harga yang lebih baik.

short_questions.questionText: What does the woman suggest the man do?
short_questions.explanation: Dia menyarankan: 'go over there and politely ask him', yang berarti berbicara langsung dengan tetangga.

options: He is too busy to help
short_questions.explanation: Idiom 'swamped with work' berarti dia kewalahan dengan pekerjaan dan karena itu terlalu sibuk.

options: She is definitely going to the exhibition
She has already finished the paper
She cannot go if she doesn't finish her work
The exhibition finishes at five o'clock
short_questions.explanation: Conditionals. 'Not unless' means she can only go IF she finishes the paper.

options: Leaving the car on the highway
short_questions.explanation: He suggests calling the 'auto club' to tow it, which is professional assistance.

options: They should go on a boat trip
She is in a similar situation as the man
She is not worried about the exam
short_questions.explanation: Idiom. 'In the same boat' means facing the same difficult situation or problem.

short_questions.questionText: Where does this conversation most likely take place?
short_questions.explanation: Keywords 'deposit', 'check', 'savings account', and 'deposit slip' clearly indicate a bank.

options: She paid someone else to repair it
short_questions.explanation: Causative verb structure. 'Had a plumber do it' means she arranged for a professional to do the work.

options: He will definitely visit his parents
He is not working this weekend
He needs a substitute for his job to be able to go
The bookstore is closed this weekend
short_questions.explanation: He says 'Only if I can get someone to cover my shift', meaning his trip depends on finding a substitute.

options: She agrees that the lecture was boring
She fell asleep during the lecture
She wants the man to tell her more
short_questions.explanation: 'You're telling me' indicates agreement. 'Struggled to stay awake' means it was boring.

options: The woman slipped on the floor
The woman forgot about the meeting
short_questions.explanation: Idiom. 'Slipped your mind' means to forget something.

options: She will come to the party late
She wants to bring her sister
short_questions.explanation: She expresses a wish about the past ('wish I hadn't promised'), implying she DID promise to babysit and thus cannot come.
Context clues. 'Back tooth', 'pain', and 'open wide' are typical of a dentist.

short_questions.questionText: What does the woman warn the man about?
short_questions.explanation: Idiom. 'Bite off more than you can chew' means to take on more work or responsibility than one can handle.

options: He arrived after the store had closed
short_questions.explanation: He says 'they had already locked the doors', meaning the store was closed when he arrived.
She suggests 'take a break' and 'look out the window', which are ways to rest his eyes.

options: The professor was in a bad mood
The professor fell out of bed
short_questions.explanation: Idiom. 'Got up on the wrong side of the bed' means to be in a bad mood / irritable for the day.

short_questions.questionText: What does the woman imply about the bus?
short_questions.explanation: She says it was on time 'for once', implying that being on time is rare and it is usually late.

options: He will lend her the notes
short_questions.explanation: He refuses politely ('I'd love to, but...') because he has a test, implying he needs the notes to study.

short_questions.questionText: What does the woman want to do?
short_questions.explanation: Idiom. 'Take a rain check' means to decline an invitation now but suggest doing it at a later time.
Idiom. 'I couldn't be happier' means he is extremely happy/pleased about the news.

short_questions.questionText: What are the speakers probably going to do?
options: Go to court for a legal case
short_questions.explanation: Keywords 'rackets' and 'courts' (reserved for sports) strongly indicate playing tennis.

options: He has a lot of money
short_questions.explanation: He lists reasons: 'cheap', 'fast', 'don't have to cook'. These are reasons of convenience.

short_questions.questionText: Where does this conversation take place?
short_questions.explanation: Context clues 'overdue books' and 'fine' are specific to a library setting.

options: She has already chosen a class
She is undecided between two choices
She wants to take both classes
short_questions.explanation: Idiom. 'I'm torn between...' means she is finding it difficult to choose between the options.

options: Waiting for the traffic to clear
short_questions.explanation: He says 'We should probably take the tunnel instead' to avoid the accident.

short_questions.questionText: What does the woman suggest the man do?
options: Start the experiment over from the beginning
short_questions.explanation: Idiom. 'Go back to square one' means to start over from the beginning.

short_questions.questionText: What does the man say about Tom?
short_questions.explanation: Idiom. 'Itchy feet' refers to a strong urge to travel or move from place to place.

options: The man should buy a new jacket
The man can clean the jacket himself
The dry cleaner is closed today
The man can get his jacket cleaned quickly nearby
short_questions.explanation: She mentions a dry cleaner 'around the corner' with 'same-day service', implying he can get it done there quickly.

options: He did not understand the lecture at all
short_questions.explanation: Idiom. 'It was all Greek to me' means something was completely unintelligible or hard to understand.

options: She is angry that he is late
She is worried about the bus
short_questions.explanation: She says 'Better late than never' and invites him to sit, showing she is accepting of the situation.

short_questions.questionText: Why does the man refuse the cake?
options: He is trying to lose weight or stay fit
short_questions.explanation: Idiom. 'Watching my waistline' means being careful about what one eats to avoid gaining weight.

short_questions.questionText: How does the woman feel about the news?
options: She is happy about the changes
She is upset about the high cost
short_questions.explanation: Idiom. 'Costing me an arm and a leg' means it is very expensive. She is upset about the price increase.

short_questions.questionText: What will the man probably do?
options: Look for medicine in his desk
Give the woman a glass of water
short_questions.explanation: He says 'I think I have a bottle in my desk drawer. Let me check.'

options: She needs to pack her bags
She is prepared to leave immediately
She wants to miss the flight
short_questions.explanation: She says 'I'm all packed and ready to go', indicating she is prepared.

short_questions.questionText: What does the man think is the problem?
options: The printer is not plugged in
short_questions.explanation: He asks 'Did you check if it's out of paper?' and calls it the 'culprit' (cause of the problem).

options: The task was easy for her
She is too tired to help
short_questions.explanation: Idiom. 'No sweat' means it was easy or no problem. She confirms 'It wasn't as heavy as it looked'.

options: He definitely wants to go hiking
He will listen to the weather report
He will decide later depending on the situation
short_questions.explanation: Idiom. 'Play it by ear' means to improvise or decide as the situation develops rather than having a fixed plan.

options: The man will be very busy
The man needs to buy paint
The man should wash his hands
The man's brother will help him
short_questions.explanation: Idiom. 'Have your hands full' means to be very busy or occupied with a task.

options: The company is making a lot of profit
The company is painting the office red
The company is hiring new staff
short_questions.explanation: Idiom. 'In the red' is a financial term meaning losing money or being in debt.

short_questions.questionText: What does the woman advise the man?
options: To learn how to play guitar
short_questions.explanation: She says 'I wouldn't if I were you', which is a way of advising against an action.

options: Waiting until the next day to solve it
short_questions.explanation: Idiom. 'Sleep on it' means to delay making a decision or solving a problem until the next day, usually after resting.
Idiom. 'Passed with flying colors' means to pass a test or complete a task with distinction or very high success.

short_questions.questionText: What does the man offer to do?
options: Make a new drink for free
short_questions.explanation: Idiom. 'On the house' means something is provided for free. The man offers to make a fresh one for free.
Phrase. 'Retracing your steps' means going back to where you came from to find something lost.
He calls the roommate a 'slob', which refers to a person who is untidy or messy.

options: She does not have the book
She will lend him the book
short_questions.explanation: She says she 'lent it to Sarah', meaning she no longer has it to lend to the man.

short_questions.questionText: Why did the man refuse the job?
short_questions.explanation: Idiom. 'Peanuts' is used to describe a very small amount of money.
She mentions seeing tickets available on a 'resale website'.
He says the AC is on 'full blast' (maximum power) but can't keep up with the 'heatwave' (extreme heat).

options: The man should buy a new computer
The man made a mistake by not saving copies
The man can easily recover the file
short_questions.explanation: She says he 'learned the hard way to back up your files', implying he should have saved copies.

short_questions.questionText: Why won't the man join the gym?
short_questions.explanation: Idiom. 'Way out of my league' in this financial context means it is too expensive for his budget.
The man smells burning and the woman says 'Oh no, the lasagna!', indicating she burnt the food.

options: Using technology to find the way
short_questions.explanation: He suggests using the 'GPS on your phone', which is using technology.

short_questions.questionText: What does the woman advise the man to do?
options: Sign up for the waiting list
short_questions.explanation: She explicitly says 'You should get on the waiting list'.

short_questions.questionText: What will the man do this weekend?
short_questions.explanation: Idiom. 'Hit the books' means to study hard.

options: Modern technology can be overly complicated
short_questions.explanation: She says 'simpler is better' and notes her old phone didn't give her trouble, implying the new complex one is the problem.
He blames the change in the 'bus schedule', which is a public transportation issue.

options: It is too noisy to work
The woman is talking too much
short_questions.explanation: He says he 'can't concentrate' because of the 'drilling noise'.

options: Helping the woman make a choice
short_questions.explanation: He weighs the options (scarf vs necklace) to help her decide.

short_questions.questionText: What is the speakers' opinion of the movie?
options: They thought it was too short
short_questions.explanation: The man calls it a 'waste of time' and the woman was 'tempted to walk out', showing they disliked it.

options: The woman cannot see the dentist on Tuesday
short_questions.explanation: He says 'Tuesday is fully booked', meaning no appointments are available that day.
He says 'I just got a parking ticket', which is a fine for parking violations.

questions.questionText: What is the main purpose of the conversation?
options: To discuss a new recycling program
To apply for a student government position
questions.explanation: Para mahasiswa sedang membahas implementasi 'a new comprehensive recycling program on campus'.

questions.questionText: According to the man, what is the biggest challenge to the program?
options: Finding a space for the bins
questions.explanation: Pria itu secara eksplisit menyatakan bahwa 'generating interest among the student body is our greatest hurdle'.

questions.questionText: What does the woman suggest to improve student participation?
options: Holding a recycling competition between dorms
Giving out free coffee to recyclers
questions.explanation: Dia menyarankan, 'What if we had a competition to see which dorm can recycle the most?'

questions.questionText: What will the man do next?
options: Draft a proposal for the competition
questions.explanation: Di akhir, dia berkata, 'I'll get started on drafting that proposal right away'.

questions.questionText: What is the main topic of the lecture?
options: The formation of the solar system
The differences between comets and asteroids
The distance from Earth to Mars
questions.explanation: Profesor menyatakan bahwa kuliah hari ini akan membahas perbedaan antara komet dan asteroid: 'Today we are going to clarify the difference between... comets and asteroids.'

questions.questionText: How does the professor describe a comet?
questions.explanation: Profesor secara eksplisit berkata: 'You can think of a comet as a dirty snowball.'

questions.questionText: Where are most asteroids located?
questions.explanation: Pembicaraan menyebutkan: 'Most of them are found in the Asteroid Belt, a vast ring located between the orbits of Mars and Jupiter.'

questions.questionText: What happens when a comet gets close to the Sun?
questions.explanation: Profesor menjelaskan bahwa es memanas 'creating a glowing atmosphere and a tail'.

questions.questionText: What prevented people from using early elevators for passengers?
options: They were dangerous if the cable broke
They were only allowed in factories
questions.explanation: Pemandu menjelaskan bahwa jika kabel putus, lift akan jatuh, sehingga orang takut menggunakannya: 'If the lifting cable snapped, the car would crash... people were afraid to use them.'

questions.questionText: What did Elisha Otis invent?
questions.explanation: Pemandu menjelaskan: 'He invented a safety brake.'

questions.questionText: How did Otis demonstrate his invention?
options: He ordered the rope to be cut while standing on the elevator
He built the Empire State Building
He wrote a book about it
He dropped a heavy box from a tower
questions.explanation: Teks menyatakan: 'He stood on an elevator platform and ordered the rope to be cut.'

questions.questionText: What was the result of this invention?
options: It allowed for the construction of skyscrapers
It caused the World's Fair to close
It reduced the cost of steel
questions.explanation: Pemandu menyimpulkan: 'This invention gave architects the confidence to design tall buildings.'

questions.questionText: What is the main topic of the lecture?
options: The life cycle of a queen bee
questions.explanation: Profesor membahas bagaimana lebah berkomunikasi menggunakan 'waggle dance' untuk berbagi informasi tentang makanan.

questions.questionText: What is the 'waggle dance' used for?
options: To indicate distance and direction of food
questions.explanation: Profesor berkata: 'This dance tells the other bees two things: the distance and the direction of the food.'

questions.questionText: How do bees indicate direction?
options: By the loudness of their buzz
By the angle of the dance relative to the sun
questions.explanation: Pembicaraan menyatakan: 'The angle of the dance relates to the position of the sun, indicating direction.'

questions.questionText: What determines the distance to the food source?
questions.explanation: Profesor menjelaskan: 'The duration of the waggle part of the dance indicates how far away the flowers are.'

questions.questionText: What characterized art before Impressionism?
options: It was realistic and highly detailed
questions.explanation: Profesor berkata: 'Before this, art was expected to be realistic and highly detailed.'

questions.questionText: What did Impressionists want to capture?
options: The momentary effect of light and color
The anatomy of the human body
questions.explanation: They 'wanted to capture the momentary effect of light and color.'

questions.questionText: What does 'en plein air' mean?
questions.explanation: Profesor mendefinisikannya sebagai: 'en plein air, or outdoors.'

questions.questionText: How did critics initially react to Impressionism?
options: They hated it and called it unfinished
questions.explanation: Teks menyatakan: 'At first, critics hated it, calling the works unfinished sketches.'

questions.questionText: How does the speaker describe the Earth's outer shell?
questions.explanation: The speaker says it is 'broken into large pieces called tectonic plates.'

questions.questionText: How fast do tectonic plates move?
questions.explanation: Pembicara membandingkan kecepatannya dengan: 'about the same speed that your fingernails grow.'

questions.questionText: What happens when plates interact at their boundaries?
questions.explanation: Pembicara menyebutkan bahwa interaksi lempeng menyebabkan bencana alam: 'they cause earthquakes, volcanic eruptions...'

questions.questionText: What is the theory called?
questions.explanation: Pembicara secara eksplisit menyatakan: 'This theory is called Plate Tectonics.'

questions.questionText: Why is the student visiting the professor?
options: To ask for a grade change
To discuss his research paper topic
questions.explanation: Mahasiswa berkata: 'I wanted to discuss my topic for the final research paper.'

questions.questionText: What was the student's initial topic idea?
options: Impact of social media on marketing
questions.explanation: Dia mengusulkan: 'analyzing the impact of social media on modern marketing.'

questions.questionText: What was the professor's main feedback?
options: The student should change his major
The topic is perfect as is
questions.explanation: Profesor memberikan saran untuk mempersempit topik yang terlalu luas: 'it is also extremely broad... I suggest you narrow it down.'

questions.questionText: How did the student narrow down the topic?
options: By focusing on Instagram and small businesses
questions.explanation: Dia menyarankan: 'focus specifically on how small businesses use Instagram'.

questions.questionText: What is a coral actually composed of?
questions.explanation: Profesor menjelaskan: 'it is actually a colony of tiny animals called polyps.'

questions.questionText: What is the relationship between coral and zooxanthellae?
questions.explanation: Kuliah menyatakan: 'These polyps have a fascinating symbiotic relationship with microscopic algae.'

questions.questionText: What happens during 'coral bleaching'?
options: The coral turns white because it expels the algae
The coral moves to colder water
questions.explanation: Karang membuang alga simbiotiknya sehingga berubah menjadi putih: 'corals... expel these algae. This causes the coral to turn completely white.'

questions.questionText: What is the main cause of coral bleaching mentioned in the lecture?
questions.explanation: Penyebab utama pemutihan karang adalah kenaikan suhu air: 'when water temperatures rise due to climate change...'

questions.questionText: What is the main topic of the lecture?
options: The difference between short-term and long-term memory
questions.explanation: Profesor memperkenalkan topik: 'The most common model divides memory into two main types: short-term and long-term memory.'

questions.questionText: To what does the professor compare short-term memory?
questions.explanation: Profesor secara eksplisit berkata: 'It's like a computer's RAM.'

questions.questionText: About how long does information stay in short-term memory without rehearsal?
questions.explanation: Teks menyatakan: 'You can hold information there for about 20 to 30 seconds.'

questions.questionText: What is required to move information into long-term memory?
questions.explanation: Profesor menjelaskan: 'you need to use a process called rehearsal or encoding.'

questions.questionText: Why did the student visit the career counselor?
options: To find a job after graduation
To get help with his resume for an internship
questions.explanation: Mahasiswa berkata: 'I'm planning to apply for summer internships, but I'm really struggling with my resume.'

questions.questionText: What is the student worried about regarding his resume?
options: It is too empty because he lacks experience
The font size is too small
questions.explanation: Dia menyebutkan: 'I feel like it's too empty. I haven't had a real job before.'

questions.questionText: What does the counselor say about volunteer work?
options: It does not count as experience
It counts as experience and shows dedication
It should be removed from the resume
It is only useful for scholarships
questions.explanation: Dia meyakinkannya: 'volunteer work counts as experience! It shows dedication and skill.'

questions.questionText: What does the counselor suggest the student do next?
options: Attend a Resume Workshop on Thursday
questions.explanation: Dia merekomendasikan: 'I recommend you attend our Resume Workshop this Thursday.'

questions.questionText: What is the main difference between Realism and Romanticism mentioned by the professor?
options: Realism depicts life as it is, while Romanticism focuses on idealism
Realism focuses on poetry, while Romanticism focuses on novels
questions.explanation: Profesor menyatakan: 'While Romanticism focused on emotion and idealism, Realism tried to depict life exactly as it was.'

questions.questionText: Why does the professor mention Mark Twain?
options: He was a central figure of the Realism movement
questions.explanation: Teks berkata: 'A central figure of this movement was Mark Twain.'

questions.questionText: What was unique about the dialogue in 'Huckleberry Finn'?
options: It used the specific dialect of the American South
questions.explanation: Profesor menjelaskan penggunaan dialek lokal oleh Mark Twain agar karakter terdengar nyata: 'Twain used the specific dialect of the American South... he made them speak like real people.'

questions.questionText: What subjects did Realist writers focus on?
questions.explanation: Kuliah menyimpulkan: 'Realist writers focused on everyday events, common people, and social problems.'

questions.questionText: Where does geothermal energy come from?
questions.explanation: Pembicara menyatakan: 'This energy comes from the heat stored inside the Earth.'

questions.questionText: What is the main advantage of geothermal energy over solar and wind?
options: It is consistent and available 24 hours a day
questions.explanation: Pembicara menekankan: 'One of the biggest advantages... is consistency... available 24 hours a day.'

questions.questionText: Why do solar panels and wind turbines have limitations according to the talk?
options: They depend on weather conditions (sun and wind)
questions.explanation: Pembicara mencatat: 'Solar panels don't work at night, and wind turbines stop when the air is still.'

questions.questionText: Where are geothermal resources most commonly found?
options: In the middle of the desert
Along major plate boundaries like the 'Ring of Fire'
questions.explanation: Teks menyebutkan: 'found along major plate boundaries... such as the Ring of Fire.'

questions.questionText: What is the student's problem?
options: Her roommate has a conflicting schedule
questions.explanation: Dia menjelaskan: 'my roommate and I have very different schedules... She studies late at night... and I have 8 AM classes.'

questions.questionText: What is the 'freeze period'?
options: A time when the heating is turned off
The first two weeks when no moves are allowed
A time when students must stay indoors
questions.explanation: Petugas mendefinisikannya sebagai: 'a freeze period for the first two weeks of classes where no moves are allowed.'

questions.questionText: Why does the university have a freeze period?
options: To verify who actually arrived on campus
questions.explanation: Petugas berkata: 'This gives us time to verify who actually arrived on campus.'

questions.questionText: What can the student do today?
options: Move to a new room immediately
Fill out a transfer request form
questions.explanation: Petugas menyimpulkan: 'You can fill out this transfer request form today, but we can't process the move until next Monday.'
